intro: Poikilospermum forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' poikilospermum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dark seeds. Poikilospermum forbesii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
